definition: to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal

sentences.chinese: 無遮蓋的人體畫像，有時具有諷喻意義。

sentences.english: With the arrival of winter, the snow and ice would help to cover the pipeline.
sentences.chinese: 隨着冬天的來臨，冰雪會將管道遮蓋住。

sentences.english: And the long grass o'ertops the moldering wall.
sentences.chinese: 長長的野草遮蓋著敗瓦。

sentences.english: No fragrance or scent masking agents.
sentences.chinese: 沒有香味或氣味遮蓋劑。

sentences.english: What this sort of near-propaganda obscures, though, is the real benefits of open source software.
sentences.chinese: 這類近似佈道的論調遮蓋了開源軟件的真正好處。

sentences.english: Cloaked before me, right within my immediate reach was a beautiful life worth living.
sentences.chinese: 被遮蓋住的是我觸手可及的值得去生活的美麗人生。

sentences.english: Possess immaculate cover efficacy, effective punish and carry average Bright non-uniform complexion.
sentences.chinese: 具有無瑕遮蓋功效，有效均整和提亮不均勻的膚色。

sentences.english: The street is over arched by ginkgoes.
sentences.chinese: 那條街道給拱形的銀杏樹遮蓋着。

sentences.english: To cover defects, eliminate dark skin to make your skin rosy.
sentences.chinese: 遮蓋瑕疵，消除肌膚暗淡，讓您的肌膚白裏透紅。

sentences.english: Beauty is life when life unveils her holy face.
sentences.chinese: 當生命摘去遮蓋她聖潔面容的面紗時，美就是生命。

sentences.english: Keep in mind that higher sodium content tends to mask the peanut flavor.
sentences.chinese: 請牢牢記住，高鈉含量往往會遮蓋花生的風味。

sentences.english: The contralateral, untreated eyes of chickens served as self-control group.
sentences.chinese: 左眼不遮蓋爲自身對照組。

sentences.english: You can’t see it because it is covered with fog. Although you can’t see it, I know it is there.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸，廟就在那兒，你看不見是因爲它被霧遮蓋住了。

sentences.english: At this time of year, when the sun goes in, it is suddenly much colder.
sentences.chinese: 每年到這時，太陽被遮蓋，天氣驟冷。

sentences.english: Why do Muslim women cover themselves from head to toe?
sentences.chinese: 爲何穆斯林女性要把她們的頭到腳趾都遮蓋起來呢？

sentences.english: And avoid diamonds that are brown or yellow, which may hinder brilliance.
sentences.chinese: 還要避免購買偏棕或偏黃的鑽石，以免光澤被遮蓋。

definition: to conceal/to hide behind/to cover up
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to polish (a written piece)/to qualify or modify (grammar)
